meanings.definition: Covered in or exuding moisture or liquid
meanings.sent1: The oozy mud made it hard to walk through the field.
meanings.sent2: Her hands were oozy after playing in the water.
meanings.sent3: The oozy jellyfish looked like a squishy blob.
meanings.sent4: The swamp was an oozy mess of mud and water.
meanings.sent5: The oozy slime dripped slowly down the wall.

meanings.definition: Having a soft, wet, and sticky texture
meanings.sent1: The oozy dough stuck to my fingers as I kneaded it.
meanings.sent2: The ripe peach was juicy and oozy when bitten into.
meanings.sent3: The oozy glue made a sticky mess on the table.
meanings.sent4: The melted chocolate was warm and oozy on the cake.
meanings.sent5: The oozy marshmallow stretched as it was pulled apart.

meanings.sent1: The oozy sap dripped slowly from the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The wound was oozy and required a bandage.
meanings.sent3: The oozy paint oozed out of the tube in a blob.
meanings.sent4: The oozy lava flowed down the volcano's slope.
meanings.sent5: The oozy honey stuck to the spoon as it was drizzled.
